#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Increase Your Artistic Abilities
#Text=Have you always wanted to be artsy but just did n't think you had any artistic ability ?
#Text=Think again !
#Text=Art is a question mark - it can be anything , as long as it means something .
#Text=Here you will learn how to discover and increase your artistic ability .
#Text=Steps
#Text=The first thing you need to do is realize that inspiration is art .
#Text=So , get inspired !
#Text=Take note of things and people around you that inspire you or make you think deeply .
#Text=Use these things and people as inspiration for your art .
#Text=Research the different types of art there are .
#Text=There is an exhaustive list of things that are considered art , some mainstream , most not .
#Text=Try your hand at any of them that you are interested in .
#Text=Figure out your " niche " in art .
#Text=You could be multi-talented , and with practice anyone can become great at what they do .
#Text=A lot of the time though , someone will have a " niche , " one specific way of creating art that they 're good with and tend to stick with .
#Text=For some it 's drawing , for some it 's painting , for some it 's sculpture , for some it 's photography .
#Text=Some of us do more modern takes on art like collage or even graffiti .
#Text=You can figure out your niche by experimenting with different areas of art that you 're interested in and finding out which ones you 're naturally talented with .
#Text=Go to art shows , museums , or even just the art rooms at your school and look at all the art that people create .
#Text=Other art may inspire you , but the main point of this exercise is to get an idea of just how vast of an area the simple word " art " covers .

column1: #Text=Realize that art is not relegated only to plastic arts ( art in which material is used to create a tangible thing ) .
#Text=Art can also mean the performing arts - music , dance , theatre , etc. Art can even mean cooking , as in culinary arts !
#Text=Technology is your friend .
#Text=If you find you have some abilities with graphic design , that can be your art .
#Text=As I said , art can be just about anything , as long as it means something .
#Text=Experiment with them ALL !
#Text=You can make art out of just about anything .
#Text=You do n't have to spend a lot of money to create good art .
#Text=A pencil and a sheet of paper can yield a fantastic poem , story , or drawing .
#Text=A cheap set of watercolors and a cheap watercolor pad can make a beautiful painting .
#Text=Opening up your mouth and singing something a cappella can lead to a wonderful song .
#Text=Buy a can of spray paint and try your hand at graffiti .
#Text=Print pictures off of the Internet , cut pictures out of magazines , and get a stick of glue and a piece of cardboard and try making a collage .
#Text=Grab your digital camera and snap some pictures , it may lead to a great piece of photography .
#Text=Do anything , as long as you are giving it some sort of meaning .
#Text=The most important thing to realize when you 're trying to be artistic is that art is making something tangible out of the intangible , and it is not always easy .

#Text=You 're trying to take yourself , your own feelings , another person , their feelings , etc. , and create something that can be seen , heard , touched , smelled , tasted - something that can be experienced on a whole other level .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Be happy with what you created , and always keep improving your work !
#Text=Professional artists practice over and over again , until they the image that was in their head , right in front of them !
#Text=Not everyone will like your art .
#Text=Be OK with this !
#Text=Some of the best-known artists of days gone by were not appreciated in their time but they kept going anyway .
#Text=The main point of art is to express yourself , not to please others !
#Text=This is optional , but try to develop a rule !
#Text=For example , Georges-Pierre Seurat painted just using little dots .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Be aware that if you decide to try art on public property ( for example , graffiti ) , it may be illegal to do so and you could face prosecution if caught .
#Text=Proceed with doing art on public property at your own risk .
